action.content:
You are playing a text adventure game. I will describe what you can perceive in the game. You write the single action you want to take in the game starting with >. Only reply with an action.
For example:
> open cupboard

Your goal for this game is: Put the book on the table, the plate on the table and the mop on the table.

Once you have achieved your goal, write "> done" to end the game.

You are in a bedroom now. There are a pillow, a wardrobe and a bed. The pillow is on the bed. The wardrobe is closed. There is a passage to a hallway here.
The wardrobe is now open. The wardrobe is empty.
You are in a hallway now. There is a potted plant. The potted plant is on the floor. There are passages to a broom closet, a kitchen, a living room and a bedroom here.
You are in a kitchen now. There are a plate, a counter and a cupboard. The plate is on the counter. The cupboard is closed. There are passages to a hallway and a pantry here.
The cupboard is now open. The cupboard is empty.
You take the plate. In your inventory you have a plate.

> put plate on table
> go to bedroom
> take pillow
> go to hallway
> done
You can't see a table here.

> put plate on floor
> go to bedroom
> take pillow
> go to hallway
You can't see a floor here.

> put plate on counter
> go to bedroom
> take pillow
> go to hallway
You put the plate on the counter.

> go to kitchen
> take plate
> go to bedroom
> take pillow
> go to hallway
